requirement_tested: Implement a homepage with a search interface for trains, flights, and hotels
user_persona: A frequent traveler planning a weekend getaway.
user_goal: To quickly find available travel options for a train journey from New York to Boston.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the travel website and sees a clean homepage with a prominent search form. She notices the 'Trains' tab is already selected.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the homepage layout.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Homepage displays a centered card with 'Trains', 'Flights', and 'Hotels' tabs. Peach puff background with Indian red accents on active elements.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Search Form
narrative_steps.description: Sarah fills in her origin (New York), destination (Boston), selects next Friday's date, sets 2 passengers, and chooses first class.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in origin, destination, select date, set passenger count, and choose class option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All fields accept input normally. The 'Search' button becomes enabled after required fields are filled.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Search Request
narrative_steps.description: Confident in her selections, Sarah clicks the 'Search' button to see available train options.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Search' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page redirects to the search results page showing train options between New York and Boston.

requirement_tested: Provide a search results page displaying available trains, air tickets, and hotel options
user_persona: A business traveler looking for the best flight deal to San Francisco.
user_goal: To find and sort flights to San Francisco by lowest price.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Flight Results
narrative_steps.description: David arrives on the search results page after searching for flights to San Francisco. He sees several flight options listed.
narrative_steps.action: Load the search results page for flights.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two-column layout appears with filter sidebar on left and flight cards displayed in main area. Peach puff background with Indian red highlights.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting by Lowest Price
narrative_steps.description: Wanting the cheapest option, David uses the sort dropdown and selects 'Lowest Price'.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Lowest Price' from the sort dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Flight cards reorder instantly to show the cheapest options first.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filter
narrative_steps.description: David decides he only wants non-stop flights and applies the 'Direct Flights Only' filter.
narrative_steps.action: Check the 'Direct Flights Only' checkbox in the filters sidebar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update immediately to show only non-stop flights matching his criteria.

requirement_tested: Enable users to select and book specific travel options with date and passenger details
user_persona: A family planning a vacation to Orlando.
user_goal: To book a hotel room for four people over spring break.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Hotel Option
narrative_steps.description: Maria finds a suitable hotel on the results page and clicks its 'Book Now' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Book Now' button on a hotel listing card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the booking confirmation page showing the selected hotel details.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Passenger Information
narrative_steps.description: On the booking page, Maria enters names and ages for all four family members.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in passenger name and age fields for each person.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each field accepts the input correctly without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Proceeding to Payment
narrative_steps.description: After confirming everyone's details are correct, Maria clicks to continue to payment.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Continue to Payment' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form validates successfully and proceeds to the secure payment gateway page.

requirement_tested: Integrate a secure payment gateway for processing online transactions
user_persona: A cautious online shopper concerned about security.
user_goal: To safely pay for a booked flight using a credit card.

narrative_steps.title: Reaching Payment Page
narrative_steps.description: James has completed his booking and now sees the payment page hosted by a trusted third-party provider.
narrative_steps.action: Load the payment gateway iframe/page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Secure payment page loads within the site, showing total amount due and accepted payment methods. Visual cues indicate SSL encryption.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Card Details
narrative_steps.description: James carefully types in his credit card number, expiration date, and CVV code.
narrative_steps.action: Enter credit card number, expiration date, and CVV into respective fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Fields format input appropriately and do not expose sensitive data visually.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Transaction
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the security measures, James submits his payment information.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Pay Now' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Payment processes successfully and redirects James to an order confirmation screen with booking details.

requirement_tested: Develop an order management section where users can view their booking history and status
user_persona: A regular customer checking past travel arrangements.
user_goal: To review the status of a previously booked train ticket.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Order History
narrative_steps.description: Robert logs into his account and navigates to the order management section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the order management/dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tabbed interface appears showing upcoming, past, and canceled bookings with Indian red status badges.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Specific Booking
narrative_steps.description: Robert looks through his past bookings and finds the train ticket he took last month.
narrative_steps.action: Browse through the 'Past Bookings' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List of historical bookings displays with clear dates, destinations, and 'Completed' status tags.

narrative_steps.title: Expanding Booking Details
narrative_steps.description: Curious about specifics, Robert clicks on the booking card to see more information.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a specific booking card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Card expands to reveal booking reference, payment receipt link, and cancellation policy details.

requirement_tested: Create user authentication and registration functionality
user_persona: A new visitor wanting to save travel preferences.
user_goal: To create an account and log in to access personalized features.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Registration
narrative_steps.description: Lisa visits the site for the first time and decides to register to save her favorite destinations.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Register' link in the header navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Registration modal/panel slides open with email, password, and confirm password fields styled with Indian red accents.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Lisa fills out her desired email and strong password, then submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in registration fields and click 'Register' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Account is created successfully and Lisa is automatically logged in, seeing a welcome message.

narrative_steps.title: Logging Out and Back In
narrative_steps.description: Later, Lisa logs out and returns the next day, needing to log back in.
narrative_steps.action: Log out, then return and click 'Login' to enter credentials.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Login screen appears; after entering correct credentials, Lisa gains access to her dashboard.

requirement_tested: Design responsive UI components with peach puff background and indian red accents
user_persona: A mobile user browsing travel deals during commute.
user_goal: To seamlessly browse and interact with the travel site on a smartphone.

narrative_steps.title: Mobile Homepage Experience
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the travel site on his phone while commuting and observes the layout adaptation.
narrative_steps.action: Visit homepage on a mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site renders responsively with stacked content, appropriately sized touch targets, and maintained color scheme (peach puff background, Indian red buttons).

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Components
narrative_steps.description: Alex taps through different tabs and interacts with form elements to search for hotels.
narrative_steps.action: Tap tabs and fill form fields on mobile screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tabs switch smoothly, form fields are easily tappable, and focus states appear clearly with Indian red borders.

narrative_steps.title: Responsive Results Display
narrative_steps.description: Upon searching, Alex views the results optimized for smaller screens.
narrative_steps.action: View search results on mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results display in single column with properly scaled images and readable text maintaining the site's color palette.

requirement_tested: Build backend APIs to fetch dynamic travel data from external providers
user_persona: A developer testing backend integration with external travel APIs.
user_goal: To verify that the backend correctly fetches and aggregates real-time flight data.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Data Fetch
narrative_steps.description: The backend receives a request for flight information between two cities.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to backend flight search endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend initiates calls to configured external flight APIs to gather current schedules and pricing.

narrative_steps.title: Data Aggregation
narrative_steps.description: Multiple responses from different airline APIs arrive at the backend service.
narrative_steps.action: Backend receives varied API responses.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Service normalizes disparate data formats into a unified structure for internal use.

narrative_steps.title: Returning Unified Response
narrative_steps.description: The aggregated and normalized data is prepared for delivery to the frontend.
narrative_steps.action: Prepare and send JSON response from backend.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend receives consistent, well-structured data representing available flights across providers.

requirement_tested: Set up a PostgreSQL database connection using provided environment variables
user_persona: A DevOps engineer deploying the application for the first time.
user_goal: To successfully connect the backend application to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: Before starting the application, the engineer configures the necessary database environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Set DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, DB_NAME in environment configuration.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables are correctly assigned with specified values for database connectivity.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: With environment set, the engineer starts the backend service to establish database connections.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend Node.js application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Application initializes and connects to PostgreSQL database without authentication or connection errors.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Operations
narrative_steps.description: The engineer performs a test operation to confirm database interaction works.
narrative_steps.action: Execute a sample database query through the running backend.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Query executes successfully, returning expected data from the connected PostgreSQL instance.

requirement_tested: Ensure all frontend data is fetched dynamically via backend APIs
user_persona: A front-end developer verifying decoupled architecture implementation.
user_goal: To confirm that no static or mock data is used in presenting search results.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Search Results
narrative_steps.description: Developer inspects network activity when loading train search results page.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser dev tools and navigate to train search results page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Network tab shows XHR/fetch requests being made to backend endpoints for data retrieval.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Data Source
narrative_steps.description: Developer examines the source of data populating the search result cards.
narrative_steps.action: Check React/Vue component data props or Angular bindings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Components receive data exclusively through resolved promises from backend API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming No Hardcoded Values
narrative_steps.description: Developer reviews frontend codebase to ensure no hardcoded travel data exists.
narrative_steps.action: Perform code search for static travel data arrays or objects.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Codebase contains zero instances of embedded static travel data; all sourced from backend.

requirement_tested: Support real-time availability and pricing updates for bookings
user_persona: An agent monitoring fluctuating hotel rates for a client.
user_goal: To observe automatic rate updates without manually refreshing the page.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Rate Display
narrative_steps.description: Agent opens a hotel search results page and notes the initial room prices.
narrative_steps.action: Load hotel search results page and observe displayed prices.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Hotel cards show current rates fetched from backend at time of page load.

narrative_steps.title: Waiting for Update Interval
narrative_steps.description: Agent keeps the page open and waits for the next scheduled update cycle.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for predefined interval (e.g., 30 seconds).
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background mechanism (polling/WebSocket) triggers new data fetch from backend.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Updated Prices
narrative_steps.description: Agent notices some prices have changed since opening the page.
narrative_steps.action: Monitor hotel card prices for changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Displayed prices automatically update to reflect latest values received from backend.

requirement_tested: Allow users to filter and sort search results by various criteria
user_persona: A meticulous planner seeking ideal accommodation options.
user_goal: To filter hotels by amenities and sort by guest rating.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Amenity Filters
narrative_steps.description: User wants hotels with free WiFi and breakfast included. They select these filters.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Free WiFi' and 'Breakfast Included' checkboxes in filters sidebar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Hotel results instantly filter to show only those offering selected amenities.

narrative_steps.title: Changing Sort Criterion
narrative_steps.description: Now wanting to see highest-rated hotels first, the user changes the sort option.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Highest Guest Rating' from sort dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Filtered list reorders immediately to prioritize hotels with top guest ratings.

narrative_steps.title: Combining Filters and Sorting
narrative_steps.description: User confirms that both applied filters and chosen sort method work together effectively.
narrative_steps.action: Review updated results list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results accurately represent intersection of applied filters, ordered by selected criterion.

requirement_tested: Include error handling and validation for user inputs and transactions
user_persona: A user accidentally submitting incomplete booking information.
user_goal: To be guided through correcting mistakes in booking form before proceeding.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Incomplete Form
narrative_steps.description: While booking a flight, user leaves several required fields empty and tries to proceed.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to submit booking form with missing required fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Submission is blocked and invalid fields are highlighted with red borders and descriptive error messages below each.

narrative_steps.title: Correcting Validation Errors
narrative_steps.description: User addresses highlighted issues by filling in the missing information.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in previously blank required fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Error indicators disappear as fields become valid, enabling the submit button.

narrative_steps.title: Successful Submission After Correction
narrative_steps.description: With all corrections made, user resubmits the form successfully.
narrative_steps.action: Click submit button again after fixing errors.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form passes validation, processes the booking, and redirects to payment or confirmation page.

requirement_tested: Implement admin dashboard for managing travel inventory and orders
user_persona: An administrator overseeing daily operations of the travel platform.
user_goal: To manage hotel inventory and monitor recent bookings through the admin panel.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Admin logs into the system with elevated privileges and accesses the protected admin area.
narrative_steps.action: Log in with admin credentials and navigate to /admin route.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Admin dashboard loads successfully, showing analytics and management panels with appropriate styling.

narrative_steps.title: Managing Hotel Inventory
narrative_steps.description: Admin reviews and updates details for featured hotels in the inventory section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to hotel inventory grid and edit a listing.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Editable grid allows modification of hotel attributes with changes saved persistently.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Recent Bookings
narrative_steps.description: Admin checks the latest bookings to ensure everything is processing correctly.
narrative_steps.action: View recent bookings table in admin dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Table displays up-to-date booking records with status indicators and actions for intervention if needed.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json scripts for concurrent frontend and backend development
user_persona: A developer setting up a local development environment.
user_goal: To start both frontend and backend servers simultaneously using npm scripts.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Developer clones the repository and runs the installation script to prepare dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' command in root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies install successfully without conflicts.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: With dependencies ready, developer starts both development servers concurrently.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run dev' command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently launches frontend build server (e.g., Vite) and backend Node server with hot-reload capabilities.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Dual Server Operation
narrative_steps.description: Developer verifies that both frontend and backend are running and communicating.
narrative_steps.action: Access localhost ports for FE and BE, and perform a test API call.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend serves UI on its port, backend serves APIs on its port, and cross-origin requests succeed.
